ld48-29.name: ld48-29
ld48-29.desc:
Unfinished game jam entry for the 29th LudumDare. Made with pixi.js in less than 15h. Graphics generated via code.

It will become a turn based game where players play locally on a big screen and send a sequence of actions from their smartphone.

You can test some placeholder actions: 'WASD' for movement, 'QE' for rotation, 'O' for shooting, 'P' for shockwave.

rule#34.name: rule#34
rule#34.desc:
Game created in 0 hours for the 0h game jam. My random topic was 'rule #34'. I was very tempted to re-roll.

It has become one of my favorite own games. I absolutely love the tension when it has been a while since the last pink picture.

I've ported the game to Swift (in less than a day) and, after some finishing touches, I'll publish it on the App Store. The Swift version has music, sound effects, it was made using SpriteKit and has GameCenter support, with achievements and highscores.

pzero.name: pzero
pzero.desc: WIP racing game for Pebble, inspired in F-Zero. Made in C. I'm looking forward to making a Swift and a JS port.

enitor.name: enitor
enitor.desc:
A game I made during 2013's summer for playing with my cousins.

I'm looking forward to improving the game and making some ports.

LudumPad.name: LudumPad
LudumPad.desc:
An open-source library that lets you use mobile devices as game controllers with just a few lines of code.

I won the 1st Prize at the Innovation Mashup Hackathon (Barcelona MWC2014) combining LudumPad, NFC, and other APIs.

I'm working on a release version with Glez, a UI/UX designer who works at TNW.

Kipos.name: Kipos
Kipos.desc:
Kipos is an unfinished iOS game I developed for my highschool research project. The game is about taking care of creatures with which you play minigames.

I still update it whenever I have enough free time, and I look forward to completing it someday.
Kipos.downloads: Over 80,000 downloads on the App Store, and a rating average of 4,5/5 stars

cellvorsum.name: cellvorsum
cellvorsum.desc: Game jam entry for the 26th Ludum Dare.

subclass-error.name: subclass-error
subclass-error.desc: JS workaround for subclassing errors. Both instanceof and stack are functional.

eximo.js.name: eximo.js
eximo.js.desc: Minimal spritesheet loader for HTML5 canvas (compatible with TexturePacker). It currently lacks support for spritesheets that are trimmed and/or have rotated sprites.

mustache.js.name: mustache.js
mustache.js.desc: I'm a Maintainer/Collaborator for mustache.js, a library for minimal templating with {{mustaches}} in JavaScript.

mocha.name: mocha
mocha.desc: I'm a Maintainer/Collaborator for mocha (top #10 contributor), a simple, flexible, fun JavaScript test framework for node.js and the browser.

L8RYO.name: L8RYO
L8RYO.desc: Yo service that reminds you of random unread articles in your Pocket account.

KairosHacks.name: KairosHacks Organiser, Speaker, Judge
KairosHacks.desc:
I helped organising KairosHacks, the first student hackathon in Spain. Over 200 students attended as hackers.

  • I gave a talk about Yo and Python that served as an introduction to APIs for newcomers.
  • I closed sponsorship deals with Google, GitHub, Yo and Gamedonia.
  • I was a judge for: 'Best Hack' category, 'Best Use Of Yo API' award, and 'Best Game' award.
  • I designed the staff t-shirt and the event's signs under a heavy time constraint.

    • The final sponsor list was: Skyscanner, 4 Years From Now, Mobile World Capital Barcelona, Mobile World Congress, Google Developer Group Barcelona, Barcelona Activa, m-startup-barcelona, GSMA, Zurich, Global Hackathon Seoul, Major League Hacking, Bloomberg, Entrepreneurs First, Gamedonia, Estrella Damm, GitHub, Yo.

animus.name: animus
animus.desc: The element of a person that enables them to be aware of the world and their experiences, to think, and to feel.
